bibl.title: Letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Mary Hench, April 12, 1952

div1.p: Rojas believes the new Cuban administration will, in time, be beneficial for the preservation of Camp Lazear. Rojas also believes that Rath will offer worthwhile advice on the preservation of the Finca San Jose.

div1.head: Letter from Maria Teresa Rojas to Mary Hench, April 12, 1952

opener.dateline:
QUINTA SAN JOSE
REDENCION
MARIANAO-CUBA
April 12, 1952

div1.p:
We received your charming
letter and we have appreciate it very
much, specially because we know
how fond of writing you are ...

The day of your departure
we could not arrive in time, to the
pier and went to the Malecar to see
the boat leave. We certainly were
the two women in a car waiving
to you that Dr. Hench saw. We staid
there untill the boat left the harbor
wondering if poor Mary had already
swallowed her dramamine!

I have not answed you
before waiting for Mr. Massaguer's
cartoon. He promised to send it to
me, but as it has not arrived yet.
I do not want to delay my letter
any longer. I will call him again
Ac
RT
and as soon as I have it I will
send it to you.

Miss. Tarafa's address is:
Sta. Josefina Tarafa. Aguacate no 458.
She is delighted to have made your
“conaissance”.

We are looking forward with
great pleasure to Mr. Rath's visit.
He is coming on April 29 to stay
untill May 1. I am sure he will
be able to offer some worthwhile
suggestions.

I also think the new Règime
is going to be beneficial to our plans
in regard to Camp. Lazear, but as I
told Phil, we have to wait for a while.

I hope all your mishaps has
already passed and the whole family
is doing well again.

You two are very often in our
thoughts and I do hope we will meet
again pretty soon this time.

With my regards to the rest of
the Henches, and love from Lydia
